Package it.polimi.ingsw.server.model

Class Dashboard

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.server.model.Dashboard
public class Dashboard extends Object
Models the game's dashboard of each player: Classroom contains your student, hall the ones you con move to classroom. Towers contain all the towers in the dashboard. CoinPos is the position of special column of the classroom that gives a coin to the player when he moves a student on it. TeacherTable is the table of the professor, and it fills with professor when a player has more students of one color than the other players. HallCapacity indicates how many students can there be in hall.

    • drawDashboard

      public void drawDashboard()
      Draws the dashboard, it draws a student, teacher or tower if they aren't null. If one of this previous element is null, it draws "^^^" instead.

    • setupHall

      public void setupHall(int gameMode)
      set the capacity of the hall, the number of students in the hall(7 or 9) based on the number of players in the game.
      Parameters:
      gameMode - is the number of players in the game. \requires gameMode == 2 || gameMode == 3

    • getStudentFromHall

      public Student getStudentFromHall(int i)
      Extracts a student from the hall, replacing it whit null
      Parameters:
      i - index of the chosen student to get
      Returns:
      the student in i hall's position or an NullPointerException if the requirements aren't respected.

    • addStudentToHall

      Parameters:

    • getStudentFromClassroom

      public Student getStudentFromClassroom(PawnColor studentColor)
      remove the last student of the selected color in the classroom
      Parameters:
      studentColor - the color of the student that we want to remove (\requires (studentColor.equals(CYAN); || studentColor.equals(RED); || studentColor.equals(GREEN); || studentColor.equals(YELLOW); || studentColor.equals(MAGENTA) )
      Returns:
      a student of that color

    • findLastStudent

      private Student findLastStudent(PawnColor studentColor)
      find the last student of the selected color in the classroom
      Parameters:
      studentColor - the color of the student that we are looking for (\requires (studentColor.equals(CYAN); || studentColor.equals(RED); || studentColor.equals(GREEN); || studentColor.equals(YELLOW); || studentColor.equals(MAGENTA) )
      Returns:
      the last student

    • addStudentToClassroom

      public boolean addStudentToClassroom(Student student)
      add a student in the classroom in the correspondence row, based on this color:

      • Row 1 : Green
      • Row 2 : Red
      • Row 3 : Yellow
      • Row 4 : Magenta
      • Row 5 : Cyan
